dublin_core.dcvalue: Interactive Session Content Adaptation Designing for the User The Principles for Digital Development tell us to Design for Scale and also Design with the User However when designing for scale it can be unclear which user to be designing for the end user in the pilot the organization user that will be implementing the intervention in other countries as it is scaled up or the end user when the intervention is taken to scale This session will explore this debate and focus on how to customize content adaptation tools for mHealth users Presented by Caitlin Loehr Program Officer Health Communication Capacity Collaborative HC3 Project JHU Center for Communication ProgramsAmy Lee Program Specialist JHU Center for Communication ProgramsTrinity Zan Technical Advisor FHI 360
Made available in DSpace on 2020-06-22T11:12:55Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 1 gdhf_adaptation_session_final.pptx: 5627613 bytes, checksum: 8c076524f6009704b3178c56c99eccd7 (MD5)
Global v. Local: Where to Begin?
